availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel Harris (Jefferson County, KY, peddler and flour dealer)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, wholesale flour dealer. Native of Prussia. Immigrated to the U. S. in 1851. Married to Mary A. Harris. Father of Sabal Harris, Isaac Harris, Sarah Harris, Saul Harris and Lee S. Harris. Peddler in Louisville in 1859. Grocer in Louisville in 1860. Employed Mary Hoyt as a servant in Louisville in 1860. Signed a petition as a flour dealer in May 1861 to appoint W. G. Timberlake as flour inspector.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 6, p. 287.

Twelfth Manuscript Census of the United States (1900), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 20, p. 4.
Henry Tanner, ed., The Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1859-60 (Louisville: Maxwell & Co., 1859), 104.
Find A Grave, "Samuel Harris (1825-1914)," Memorial 66670780, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/66670780 (accessed January 27, 2020).
